channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: Anthea da Silva
item.title: On my mind: artist Anthea da Silva

item.dc:creator: Adam Cooper
item.description: The man charged with murdering a two-year-old boy in Melbourne's outer south-east has pleaded not guilty and will go to trial.
item.title: Not guilty plea from man charged with murdering toddler Jaidyn Gomes

item.dc:creator: Michael Lynch
item.description: Townsville is set for a double header of motorsport with Supercars to race in far north Queensland on successive weekends.
item.title: Supercars go back-to-back in Townsville

item.dc:creator: Tom Decent
item.description: Michael Hooper has come full circle at the Waratahs and ahead of a blockbuster against the Reds, explains why recent defeats are more painful in older age.
item.title: 'We had it so close': Why losses hurt more now for Hooper

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: Australia recorded 483 new cases yesterday, with 471 of those in Victoria.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Victorian arrivals to enter NSW hotel quarantine, national cabinet meets, Australia's death toll hits 266

item.dc:creator: Jane Caro
item.description: Normally we visit the bereaved, hug them and offer comfort. Now we are finding new ways to reach out to each other with kindness, empathy and an understanding we miss one another.
item.title: When my friend's son died in lockdown, natural instincts had to be ignored

item.dc:creator: Marta Pascual Juanola
item.description: The team of electrical workers are now facing the prospect of being sent back to their hometown in Cebu, despite growing concerns of civil unrest and a COVID-19 outbreak in the Philipines.
item.title: Unions urge government to intervene on behalf of 'exploited' Filipino Austal workers

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: NSW's latest bout of wild wintry weather will bring the risk of flooding to parts of the South Coast and generate a powerful swell that could worsen beach erosion.
item.title: 'Dynamic' weather to raise flood and beach erosion fears

item.dc:creator: Nick Galvin
item.description: For a while during the pandemic lockdown, Blair French had possibly the loneliest job in the Sydney arts industry.
item.title: Wheels in motion once more at Carriageworks

item.dc:creator: Sam McClure
item.description: The holding-the-ball rule hasn't changed on paper. But it has on the field. So how did we get here and why?
item.title: Holding the ball: How did we get here?

item.dc:creator: James Massola
item.description: Two Australian journalists being investigated by Malaysian authorities for a documentary on migrant workers have had their visa renewals blocked.
item.title: Australian journalists' visas blocked after Al Jazeera doco

item.dc:creator: Helen Pitt
item.description: It didn't take long for the artist to share the news with the remote Amazonian jungle tribe that is the subject of her documentary.
item.title: Australian filmmaker Lynette Wallworth nominated for an Emmy

item.dc:creator: Sam Phillips
item.description: The Broncos legend attended the Caxton Hotel last weekend for a private birthday function.
item.title: Langer, Broncos staff placed in COVID-19 hold after attending 'private function'

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: ASIO and police have not used powers to hack into encrypted messages, as tech companies have voluntarily allowed them into their systems.
item.title: Encryption powers not used by ASIO, police as tech companies volunteer help

item.description: 450 new cases, 11 deaths in Victoria; more than 100 who should be in self-isolation not found at home; NSW records 11 new cases; Melbourne flights to arrive at Sydney's international terminal. News updates here.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: Channel Seven has secured the rights to Victoria's marquee races outside of Melbourne Cup week in a deal that has also underpins the future of Racing.com until 2025.
item.title: Inside running: Spring in air as Oaks winner set to resume

item.dc:creator: Adam Cooper
item.description: A man who shot dead a rival who had called him a "putrid dog" in a Facebook fight has been jailed for a decade.
item.title: Judge jails killer who thought he was 'living in a TV crime drama'

item.dc:creator: Anu Hasbold
item.description: In the latest episode of Good Weekend Talks, The Age investigative journalist Nick McKenzie joins Good Weekend senior writer Konrad Marshall for a conversation about Dusty Miller, the combat medic who blew the whistle on a war crime.
item.title: 'I've been with him in those dark moments'

item.dc:creator: Roy Ward
item.description: The Western Bulldogs will get back key forward Aaron Naughton but Luke Beveridge has warned his side they must improve their delivery into the forward line.
item.title: Naughton returns as Beveridge warns Bulldogs to fix delivery

item.dc:creator: Lisa Visentin
item.description: Labor and the Greens have called on Treasurer Dominic Perrottet to stand aside pending an investigation into why two of his ministerial staffers were on the payroll of icare.
item.title: Perrottet under fire over staffers' icare connections

item.dc:creator: Dominic Bossi
item.description: The Wanderers could be searching for their sixth captain in as many years with Mitchell Duke closing in on a move to Saudi Arabia.
item.title: Wanderers set to lose another captain with Duke nearing Saudi move

item.dc:creator: Marissa Calligeros
item.description: More than 100 people who should be in self-isolation could not be found when ADF personnel and health teams knocked on their doors on Thursday, Premier Daniel Andrews has revealed.
item.title: Victorians still flouting self-isolation rules as 450 new cases, 11 deaths recorded

item.description: "Clearly, the regime plans to stage another crackdown on the city's activists by all means," Wong said.
item.title: Joshua Wong and other HK activists charged over banned Tiananmen vigil

item.dc:creator: Nathan Hondros
item.description: Finance Minister Mathias Cormann has personally called on mining magnate Clive Palmer to drop his constitutional challenge to WA's border restrictions.
item.title: Cormann calls on Clive Palmer to drop legal challenge to WA border

item.dc:creator: Jon Pierik
item.description: Richmond coach Damien Hardwick abruptly cut short his press conference on Friday amid allegations two of his players groped a teammate.
item.title: Tigers accused of groping teammate

item.dc:creator: Chris Roots
item.description: Joe Pride thinks he might have two good ones in Eduardo and Minted.
item.title: 'A nice problem to have': Pride hopes for Missile lift-off with Eduardo

item.description: Fashion is being stripped back and we couldn’t be happier – think utility jackets, cargo shorts and combat boots.
item.title: The new utility

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: “It’s a most unusual situation where you have an intervention by somebody, in this case the Commonwealth, which in effect sends them to the field of battle, it goes in and has that battle and then seeks to withdraw,” WA Solicitor General Joshua Thomson said.
item.title: Commonwealth's withdrawal from Palmer challenge 'an egg that must now be unscrambled'

item.dc:creator: Jamie Brown
item.description: To get a sense of the deadly destruction wrought by 2750 tonnes of a volatile explosive material, see the before and after satellite photos.
item.title: Lebanon before and after the explosion

item.dc:creator: Nathan Hondros
item.description: Police Commissioner Chris Dawson said the man was now facing a criminal investigation because his approved application said he was returning to WA, whereas a previous application had him listed as living in Tasmania.
item.title: FIFO worker put on plane after WA border exemption attempt

item.dc:creator: Kate Hedley
item.description: A Joondalup dentist who failed to comply with self-isolation orders after flying in to Western Australia from the east coast in June will be sentenced in October.
item.title: Joondalup dentist admits breaking self-isolation order after flying in from over east

item.description: Melbourne's hard lockdown
item.title: Melbourne's hard lockdown

item.description: Australia's Jason Day has got his pursuit of a second major off to a flying start, sharing the lead after round one of the PGA Championship in California.
item.title: Day shares lead after opening round at PGA Championship

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: The New Zealand Warriors have found their long-term replacement for Stephen Kearney, opting for former Dragons and Knights coach Nathan Brown.
item.title: Nathan Brown agrees to three-year Warriors deal

item.dc:creator: Jon Pierik
item.description: Richmond has taken a cautious approach with skipper Trent Cotchin and will rest him from a potential grand-final preview against Port Adelaide on Saturday.
item.title: Power off: Cotchin to be rested from Port Adelaide clash

item.description: The results could enable them to change the constitution and strengthen dynastic rule.
item.title: Rajapaksa brothers win election by landslide

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: Channel Seven has secured the rights to Victoria's marquee races outside of Melbourne Cup week in a deal that also underpins the future of Racing.com until 2025.
item.title: Channel Seven wins five-year extension with Racing Victoria

item.dc:creator: Jacqueline Maley
item.description: NSW Health Minister Brad Hazzard put on quite a display in State Parliament on Thursday when questioned by Opposition Leader Jodi McKay over mask supplies.
item.title: Hazzard's attack confirms what many women suspect: contempt is close to the surface

item.dc:creator: Jon Pierik
item.description: Matthew Kreuzer is recovering from a serious foot injury but the Blues have yet to determine whether he will be offered a contract extension.
item.title: Kreuzer on the mend but faces uncertain future

item.dc:creator: Cara Waters
item.description: Private equity firm Quadrant has snapped up a stake in smart phone mount startup Quad Lock
item.title: Quadrant Private Equity to invest in phone mount startup Quad Lock

item.description: Coronavirus assessment centres have been established across Queensland.
item.title: Where to get tested for coronavirus in Queensland

item.dc:creator: Tom Cowie
item.description: Reservoir is a big suburb with lots of streets. Liam Vaughan isn't sure exactly how many, except that it's in the hundreds - and he's ridden all of them.
item.title: Tour de Reservoir: 'Burbing' cyclists take on all the streets they can

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: Gallery: The best photos from around the world

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: The RBA has warned it will take longer than hoped for the jobs market to recover from the coronavirus recession.
item.title: Jobs market to take longer to recover from recession: RBA

item.dc:creator: Tom Decent
item.description: All the team lists for another round of Shute Shield action.
item.title: Shute Shield round four teams

item.dc:creator: Kate Aubusson
item.description: Eleven new COVID-19 cases have been diagnosed in NSW overnight - all acquired in Australia.
item.title: NSW records 11 new COVID-19 cases amid concern over 17 venues visited by infected trio

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: "They've seen wars, they've seen terrorism, they've seen disasters and now they are facing this."
item.title: 'They can only suffer so much': Explosion leaves Beirut teetering on the brink

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: Protesters have been warned they will be arrested if they take part in a plan to block the Story Bridge on Saturday calling for refugees to be let out of hotel detention.
item.title: 'Not the time, not the place': Protesters warned off Story Bridge

item.dc:creator: Malcolm Knox
item.description: Wayne Bennett's COVID-19 breach raises an uncomfortable question. Has time caught up with the coach who seemed older than time itself?
item.title: Wayne's world always revolved around him but has the real one caught up?

item.dc:creator: Nick Toscano
item.description: The mining giant decided to destroy two 46,000-year-old Aboriginal rock shelters in order to access valuable iron ore.
item.title: Rio Tinto blasted ancient Aboriginal caves for $135m of iron ore
